oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: al-Aṣbaḥ, ‘Abdullāh, 1910-1938; Arrest; Barbed wire; Border crossing; Bribery; British colonization; Buses; Cities and towns; Crimes against individuals; Customs; Displacement; Medical care; Medical doctors; Passing on memories; Revolutionaries; Rifles; Smuggling; Trade; Village seige; Weddings; Zionist Invasion of Palestine; Akka (Palestine); Boats; Bombardment; British; British Army; Dabkah; Dalʻūnā; Disputes; Flags; Folk songs; Groom Shower; Haifa (Palestine); Invitations; Jews; Khirbat Jiddīn (Palestine); Loved ones; Musical instruments; Poems; Radio stations; Relief; Shaykhs; Weapons; Wedding songs; Wedding traditions; Dabkah; Loved ones; Musical instruments; Singing; Ululation; Wedding songs
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on September 1, 1998 with Nāyif Darwīsh ‘Alī, male, born in 1917 in Khirbat Saʻsaʻ, Palestine and resides in Nahr al-Bārid Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon. He was a trader.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع نايف درويش علي في 1 أيلول سبتمبرعام 1998، ذكر، ولد عام 1917 في خربة سعسع، فلسطين ويقيم في مخيم نهر البارد للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان. كان تاجراً.
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: Wedding celebrations and political conditions in Palestine before 1948. (@ 8:5)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: إحتفالات العرس والظروف السياسية في فلسطين قبل 1948. (@ 8:5)
